dcterms:creator: L. Blume
A. Brandenburger
E. Dekel
dcterms:description: A system that allows for the derivation of beliefs through a lexicographic ordering of probability measures, facilitating Bayesian updating in the context of uncertainty.
dcterms:title: Lexicographic Conditional Probability System (LCPS)

dcterms:creator: R. Myerson
dcterms:description: A complete system of conditional probabilities defined over a collection of events, used in the analysis of multistage games.
dcterms:title: Complete Conditional Probability System (CPS)

dcterms:creator: P. Battigalli
E. Catonini
J. Manili
dcterms:description: An argument that illustrates how belief changes can lead to inconsistencies in decision-making, particularly in sequential games.
dcterms:title: Dutch Book Argument

dcterms:creator: M. Rescorla
dcterms:description: A theorem that provides an improved framework for understanding conditionalization in the context of Dutch book arguments.
dcterms:title: Dutch Book Theorem

dcterms:creator: P. Teller
dcterms:description: An argument that discusses the implications of conditionalization and observation on belief systems, particularly in the context of Dutch books.
dcterms:title: Dutch Book Argument for Forward Consistency
